function bitcore.deps._.template (string, options, otherOptions)

  • description and source-code
    function template(string, options, otherOptions) {
  // Based on John Resig's `tmpl` implementation (http://ejohn.org/blog/javascript-micro-templating/)
  // and Laura Doktorova's doT.js (https://github.com/olado/doT).
  var settings = lodash.templateSettings;

  if (otherOptions && isIterateeCall(string, options, otherOptions)) {
    options = otherOptions = undefined;
  }
  string = baseToString(string);
  options = assignWith(baseAssign({}, otherOptions || options), settings, assignOwnDefaults);

  var imports = assignWith(baseAssign({}, options.imports), settings.imports, assignOwnDefaults),
      importsKeys = keys(imports),
      importsValues = baseValues(imports, importsKeys);

  var isEscaping,
      isEvaluating,
      index = 0,
      interpolate = options.interpolate || reNoMatch,
      source = "__p += '";

  // Compile the regexp to match each delimiter.
  var reDelimiters = RegExp(
    (options.escape || reNoMatch).source + '|' +
    interpolate.source + '|' +
    (interpolate === reInterpolate ? reEsTemplate : reNoMatch).source + '|' +
    (options.evaluate || reNoMatch).source + '|$'
  , 'g');

  // Use a sourceURL for easier debugging.
  var sourceURL = '//# sourceURL=' +
    ('sourceURL' in options
      ? options.sourceURL
      : ('lodash.templateSources[' + (++templateCounter) + ']')
    ) + '\n';

  string.replace(reDelimiters, function(match, escapeValue, interpolateValue, esTemplateValue, evaluateValue, offset) {
    interpolateValue || (interpolateValue = esTemplateValue);

    // Escape characters that can't be included in string literals.
    source += string.slice(index, offset).replace(reUnescapedString, escapeStringChar);

    // Replace delimiters with snippets.
    if (escapeValue) {
      isEscaping = true;
      source += "' +\n__e(" + escapeValue + ") +\n'";
    }
    if (evaluateValue) {
      isEvaluating = true;
      source += "';\n" + evaluateValue + ";\n__p += '";
    }
    if (interpolateValue) {
      source += "' +\n((__t = (" + interpolateValue + ")) == null ? '' : __t) +\n'";
    }
    index = offset + match.length;

    // The JS engine embedded in Adobe products requires returning the `match`
    // string in order to produce the correct `offset` value.
    return match;
  });

  source += "';\n";

  // If `variable` is not specified wrap a with-statement around the generated
  // code to add the data object to the top of the scope chain.
  var variable = options.variable;
  if (!variable) {
    source = 'with (obj) {\n' + source + '\n}\n';
  }
  // Cleanup code by stripping empty strings.
  source = (isEvaluating ? source.replace(reEmptyStringLeading, '') : source)
    .replace(reEmptyStringMiddle, '$1')
    .replace(reEmptyStringTrailing, '$1;');

  // Frame code as the function body.
  source = 'function(' + (variable || 'obj') + ') {\n' +
    (variable
      ? ''
      : 'obj || (obj = {});\n'
    ) +
    "var __t, __p = ''" +
    (isEscaping
       ? ', __e = _.escape'
       : ''
    ) +
    (isEvaluating
      ? ', __j = Array.prototype.join;\n' +
        "function print() { __p += __j.call(arguments, '') }\n"
      : ';\n'
    ) +
    source +
    'return __p\n}';

  var result = attempt(function() {
    return Function(importsKeys, sourceURL + 'return ' + source).apply(undefined, importsValues);
  });

  // Provide the compiled function's source by its `toString` method or
  // the `source` property as a convenience for inlining compiled templates.
  result.source = source;
  if (isError(result)) {
    throw result;
  }
  return result;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.throttle (func, wait, options)

  • description and source-code
    function throttle(func, wait, options) {
  var leading = true,
      trailing = true;

  if (typeof func != 'function') {
    throw new TypeError(FUNC_ERROR_TEXT);
  }
  if (options === false) {
    leading = false;
  } else if (isObject(options)) {
    leading = 'leading' in options ? !!options.leading : leading;
    trailing = 'trailing' in options ? !!options.trailing : trailing;
  }
  return debounce(func, wait, { 'leading': leading, 'maxWait': +wait, 'trailing': trailing });
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.thru (value, interceptor, thisArg)

  • description and source-code
    function thru(value, interceptor, thisArg) {
  return interceptor.call(thisArg, value);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.times (n, iteratee, thisArg)

  • description and source-code
    function times(n, iteratee, thisArg) {
  n = nativeFloor(n);

  // Exit early to avoid a JSC JIT bug in Safari 8
  // where `Array(0)` is treated as `Array(1)`.
  if (n < 1 || !nativeIsFinite(n)) {
    return [];
  }
  var index = -1,
      result = Array(nativeMin(n, MAX_ARRAY_LENGTH));

  iteratee = bindCallback(iteratee, thisArg, 1);
  while (++index < n) {
    if (index < MAX_ARRAY_LENGTH) {
      result[index] = iteratee(index);
    } else {
      iteratee(index);
    }
  }
  return result;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.toArray (value)

  • description and source-code
    function toArray(value) {
  var length = value ? getLength(value) : 0;
  if (!isLength(length)) {
    return values(value);
  }
  if (!length) {
    return [];
  }
  return arrayCopy(value);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.toPlainObject (value)

  • description and source-code
    function toPlainObject(value) {
  return baseCopy(value, keysIn(value));
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.transform (object, iteratee, accumulator, thisArg)

  • description and source-code
    function transform(object, iteratee, accumulator, thisArg) {
  var isArr = isArray(object) || isTypedArray(object);
  iteratee = getCallback(iteratee, thisArg, 4);

  if (accumulator == null) {
    if (isArr || isObject(object)) {
      var Ctor = object.constructor;
      if (isArr) {
        accumulator = isArray(object) ? new Ctor : [];
      } else {
        accumulator = baseCreate(isFunction(Ctor) ? Ctor.prototype : undefined);
      }
    } else {
      accumulator = {};
    }
  }
  (isArr ? arrayEach : baseForOwn)(object, function(value, index, object) {
    return iteratee(accumulator, value, index, object);
  });
  return accumulator;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.trim (string, chars, guard)

  • description and source-code
    function trim(string, chars, guard) {
  var value = string;
  string = baseToString(string);
  if (!string) {
    return string;
  }
  if (guard ? isIterateeCall(value, chars, guard) : chars == null) {
    return string.slice(trimmedLeftIndex(string), trimmedRightIndex(string) + 1);
  }
  chars = (chars + '');
  return string.slice(charsLeftIndex(string, chars), charsRightIndex(string, chars) + 1);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.trimLeft (string, chars, guard)

  • description and source-code
    function trimLeft(string, chars, guard) {
  var value = string;
  string = baseToString(string);
  if (!string) {
    return string;
  }
  if (guard ? isIterateeCall(value, chars, guard) : chars == null) {
    return string.slice(trimmedLeftIndex(string));
  }
  return string.slice(charsLeftIndex(string, (chars + '')));
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.trimRight (string, chars, guard)

  • description and source-code
    function trimRight(string, chars, guard) {
  var value = string;
  string = baseToString(string);
  if (!string) {
    return string;
  }
  if (guard ? isIterateeCall(value, chars, guard) : chars == null) {
    return string.slice(0, trimmedRightIndex(string) + 1);
  }
  return string.slice(0, charsRightIndex(string, (chars + '')) + 1);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.trunc (string, options, guard)

  • description and source-code
    function trunc(string, options, guard) {
  if (guard && isIterateeCall(string, options, guard)) {
    options = undefined;
  }
  var length = DEFAULT_TRUNC_LENGTH,
      omission = DEFAULT_TRUNC_OMISSION;

  if (options != null) {
    if (isObject(options)) {
      var separator = 'separator' in options ? options.separator : separator;
      length = 'length' in options ? (+options.length || 0) : length;
      omission = 'omission' in options ? baseToString(options.omission) : omission;
    } else {
      length = +options || 0;
    }
  }
  string = baseToString(string);
  if (length >= string.length) {
    return string;
  }
  var end = length - omission.length;
  if (end < 1) {
    return omission;
  }
  var result = string.slice(0, end);
  if (separator == null) {
    return result + omission;
  }
  if (isRegExp(separator)) {
    if (string.slice(end).search(separator)) {
      var match,
          newEnd,
          substring = string.slice(0, end);

      if (!separator.global) {
        separator = RegExp(separator.source, (reFlags.exec(separator) || '') + 'g');
      }
      separator.lastIndex = 0;
      while ((match = separator.exec(substring))) {
        newEnd = match.index;
      }
      result = result.slice(0, newEnd == null ? end : newEnd);
    }
  } else if (string.indexOf(separator, end) != end) {
    var index = result.lastIndexOf(separator);
    if (index > -1) {
      result = result.slice(0, index);
    }
  }
  return result + omission;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.unescape (string)

  • description and source-code
    function unescape(string) {
  string = baseToString(string);
  return (string && reHasEscapedHtml.test(string))
    ? string.replace(reEscapedHtml, unescapeHtmlChar)
    : string;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.union ()

  • description and source-code
    union = function () {
  var args = arguments,
      index = -1,
      length = nativeMax(args.length - start, 0),
      rest = Array(length);

  while (++index < length) {
    rest[index] = args[start + index];
  }
  switch (start) {
    case 0: return func.call(this, rest);
    case 1: return func.call(this, args[0], rest);
    case 2: return func.call(this, args[0], args[1], rest);
  }
  var otherArgs = Array(start + 1);
  index = -1;
  while (++index < start) {
    otherArgs[index] = args[index];
  }
  otherArgs[start] = rest;
  return func.apply(this, otherArgs);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.uniq (array, isSorted, iteratee, thisArg)

  • description and source-code
    function uniq(array, isSorted, iteratee, thisArg) {
  var length = array ? array.length : 0;
  if (!length) {
    return [];
  }
  if (isSorted != null && typeof isSorted != 'boolean') {
    thisArg = iteratee;
    iteratee = isIterateeCall(array, isSorted, thisArg) ? undefined : isSorted;
    isSorted = false;
  }
  var callback = getCallback();
  if (!(iteratee == null && callback === baseCallback)) {
    iteratee = callback(iteratee, thisArg, 3);
  }
  return (isSorted && getIndexOf() == baseIndexOf)
    ? sortedUniq(array, iteratee)
    : baseUniq(array, iteratee);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.unique (array, isSorted, iteratee, thisArg)

  • description and source-code
    function uniq(array, isSorted, iteratee, thisArg) {
  var length = array ? array.length : 0;
  if (!length) {
    return [];
  }
  if (isSorted != null && typeof isSorted != 'boolean') {
    thisArg = iteratee;
    iteratee = isIterateeCall(array, isSorted, thisArg) ? undefined : isSorted;
    isSorted = false;
  }
  var callback = getCallback();
  if (!(iteratee == null && callback === baseCallback)) {
    iteratee = callback(iteratee, thisArg, 3);
  }
  return (isSorted && getIndexOf() == baseIndexOf)
    ? sortedUniq(array, iteratee)
    : baseUniq(array, iteratee);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.unzip (array)

  • description and source-code
    function unzip(array) {
  if (!(array && array.length)) {
    return [];
  }
  var index = -1,
      length = 0;

  array = arrayFilter(array, function(group) {
    if (isArrayLike(group)) {
      length = nativeMax(group.length, length);
      return true;
    }
  });
  var result = Array(length);
  while (++index < length) {
    result[index] = arrayMap(array, baseProperty(index));
  }
  return result;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.unzipWith (array, iteratee, thisArg)

  • description and source-code
    function unzipWith(array, iteratee, thisArg) {
  var length = array ? array.length : 0;
  if (!length) {
    return [];
  }
  var result = unzip(array);
  if (iteratee == null) {
    return result;
  }
  iteratee = bindCallback(iteratee, thisArg, 4);
  return arrayMap(result, function(group) {
    return arrayReduce(group, iteratee, undefined, true);
  });
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.xor ()

  • description and source-code
    function xor() {
  var index = -1,
      length = arguments.length;

  while (++index < length) {
    var array = arguments[index];
    if (isArrayLike(array)) {
      var result = result
        ? arrayPush(baseDifference(result, array), baseDifference(array, result))
        : array;
    }
  }
  return result ? baseUniq(result) : [];
}

function bitcore.deps._.zipObject (props, values)

  • description and source-code
    function zipObject(props, values) {
  var index = -1,
      length = props ? props.length : 0,
      result = {};

  if (length && !values && !isArray(props[0])) {
    values = [];
  }
  while (++index < length) {
    var key = props[index];
    if (values) {
      result[key] = values[index];
    } else if (key) {
      result[key[0]] = key[1];
    }
  }
  return result;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

  var chainAll = this.__chain__;
  if (chain || chainAll) {
    var result = object(this.__wrapped__),
        actions = result.__actions__ = arrayCopy(this.__actions__);

    actions.push({ 'func': func, 'args': arguments, 'thisArg': object });
    result.__chain__ = chainAll;
    return result;
  }
  return func.apply(object, arrayPush([this.value()], arguments));
}

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.collect ()

  • description and source-code
    collect = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.commit ()

  • description and source-code
    function wrapperCommit() {
  return new LodashWrapper(this.value(), this.__chain__);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.compact ()

  • description and source-code
    compact = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.compose ()

  • description and source-code
    compose = function () {
  var chainAll = this.__chain__;
  if (chain || chainAll) {
    var result = object(this.__wrapped__),
        actions = result.__actions__ = arrayCopy(this.__actions__);

    actions.push({ 'func': func, 'args': arguments, 'thisArg': object });
    result.__chain__ = chainAll;
    return result;
  }
  return func.apply(object, arrayPush([this.value()], arguments));
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.concat ()

  • description and source-code
    concat = function () {
  var args = arguments,
      index = -1,
      length = nativeMax(args.length - start, 0),
      rest = Array(length);

  while (++index < length) {
    rest[index] = args[start + index];
  }
  switch (start) {
    case 0: return func.call(this, rest);
    case 1: return func.call(this, args[0], rest);
    case 2: return func.call(this, args[0], args[1], rest);
  }
  var otherArgs = Array(start + 1);
  index = -1;
  while (++index < start) {
    otherArgs[index] = args[index];
  }
  otherArgs[start] = rest;
  return func.apply(this, otherArgs);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.drop ()

  • description and source-code
    drop = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.first ()

  • description and source-code
    first = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.flatten ()

  • description and source-code
    flatten = function () {
  var chainAll = this.__chain__;
  if (chain || chainAll) {
    var result = object(this.__wrapped__),
        actions = result.__actions__ = arrayCopy(this.__actions__);

    actions.push({ 'func': func, 'args': arguments, 'thisArg': object });
    result.__chain__ = chainAll;
    return result;
  }
  return func.apply(object, arrayPush([this.value()], arguments));
}

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.head ()

  • description and source-code
    head = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

    return result;
  }
  return func.apply(object, arrayPush([this.value()], arguments));
}

  • example usage
    ...
  enabled: true,
  usePhantomJS: false,
  postDetection: function(availableBrowser) {
    // modify to enable additional browsers if available
    var runBrowsers = ['Firefox', 'Chrome'];
    var browsers = [];
    for(var i = 0; i < runBrowsers.length; i++) {
      if(~availableBrowser.indexOf(runBrowsers[i])) {
        browsers.push(runBrowsers[i]);
      }
    }
    return browsers;
  }
},
singleRun: true,
...

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.initial ()

  • description and source-code
    initial = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.isNull ()

  • description and source-code
    isNull = function () {
  var chainAll = this.__chain__;
  if (chain || chainAll) {
    var result = object(this.__wrapped__),
        actions = result.__actions__ = arrayCopy(this.__actions__);

    actions.push({ 'func': func, 'args': arguments, 'thisArg': object });
    result.__chain__ = chainAll;
    return result;
  }
  return func.apply(object, arrayPush([this.value()], arguments));
}
  • example usage
    n/a

    join = function () {
  var args = arguments;
  if (retUnwrapped && !this.__chain__) {
    return func.apply(this.value(), args);
  }
  return this[chainName](function(value) {
    return func.apply(value, args);
  });
}

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.last ()

  • description and source-code
    last = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.map ()

  • description and source-code
    map = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}

  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.pick ()

  • description and source-code
    pick = function () {
  var chainAll = this.__chain__;
  if (chain || chainAll) {
    var result = object(this.__wrapped__),
        actions = result.__actions__ = arrayCopy(this.__actions__);

    actions.push({ 'func': func, 'args': arguments, 'thisArg': object });
    result.__chain__ = chainAll;
    return result;
  }
  return func.apply(object, arrayPush([this.value()], arguments));

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.plant (value)

  • description and source-code
    function wrapperPlant(value) {
  var result,
      parent = this;

  while (parent instanceof baseLodash) {
    var clone = wrapperClone(parent);
    if (result) {
      previous.__wrapped__ = clone;
    } else {
      result = clone;
    }
    var previous = clone;
    parent = parent.__wrapped__;
  }
  previous.__wrapped__ = value;
  return result;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.pluck ()

  • description and source-code
    pluck = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

    return func.apply(this.value(), args);
  }
  return this[chainName](function(value) {
    return func.apply(value, args);
  });
}

    ...
  usePhantomJS: false,
  postDetection: function(availableBrowser) {
    // modify to enable additional browsers if available
    var runBrowsers = ['Firefox', 'Chrome'];
    var browsers = [];
    for(var i = 0; i < runBrowsers.length; i++) {
      if(~availableBrowser.indexOf(runBrowsers[i])) {
        browsers.push(runBrowsers[i]);
      }
    }
    return browsers;
  }
},
singleRun: true,

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.reject ()

  • description and source-code
    reject = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.reverse ()

  • description and source-code
    function wrapperReverse() {
  var value = this.__wrapped__;

  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (wrapped && wrapped.__dir__ < 0) ? value : value.reverse();
  };
  if (value instanceof LazyWrapper) {
    var wrapped = value;
    if (this.__actions__.length) {
      wrapped = new LazyWrapper(this);
    }
    wrapped = wrapped.reverse();
    wrapped.__actions__.push({ 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined });
    return new LodashWrapper(wrapped, this.__chain__);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code
    splice = function () {
  var args = arguments;
  if (retUnwrapped && !this.__chain__) {
    return func.apply(this.value(), args);
  }
  return this[chainName](function(value) {
    return func.apply(value, args);
  });
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.spread ()

  • description and source-code
    spread = function () {
  var chainAll = this.__chain__;
  if (chain || chainAll) {
    var result = object(this.__wrapped__),
        actions = result.__actions__ = arrayCopy(this.__actions__);

    actions.push({ 'func': func, 'args': arguments, 'thisArg': object });
    result.__chain__ = chainAll;
    return result;
  }
  return func.apply(object, arrayPush([this.value()], arguments));
}
  • example usage
    n/a

        actions = result.__actions__ = arrayCopy(this.__actions__);

    actions.push({ 'func': func, 'args': arguments, 'thisArg': object });
    result.__chain__ = chainAll;
    return result;
  }
  return func.apply(object, arrayPush([this.value()], arguments));
}

  • description and source-code
    sum = function () {
  var chainAll = this.__chain__;
  if (chain || chainAll) {
    var result = object(this.__wrapped__),
        actions = result.__actions__ = arrayCopy(this.__actions__);

    actions.push({ 'func': func, 'args': arguments, 'thisArg': object });
    result.__chain__ = chainAll;
    return result;
  }
  return func.apply(object, arrayPush([this.value()], arguments));
}
  • example usage

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.tail ()

  • description and source-code
    tail = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.take ()

  • description and source-code
    take = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}

    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.toArray ()

  • description and source-code
    toArray = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.where ()

  • description and source-code
    where = function () {
  var args = retUnwrapped ? [1] : arguments,
      chainAll = this.__chain__,
      value = this.__wrapped__,
      isHybrid = !!this.__actions__.length,
      isLazy = value instanceof LazyWrapper,
      iteratee = args[0],
      useLazy = isLazy || isArray(value);

  if (useLazy && checkIteratee && typeof iteratee == 'function' && iteratee.length != 1) {
    // Avoid lazy use if the iteratee has a "length" value other than `1`.
    isLazy = useLazy = false;
  }
  var interceptor = function(value) {
    return (retUnwrapped && chainAll)
      ? lodashFunc(value, 1)[0]
      : lodashFunc.apply(undefined, arrayPush([value], args));
  };

  var action = { 'func': thru, 'args': [interceptor], 'thisArg': undefined },
      onlyLazy = isLazy && !isHybrid;

  if (retUnwrapped && !chainAll) {
    if (onlyLazy) {
      value = value.clone();
      value.__actions__.push(action);
      return func.call(value);
    }
    return lodashFunc.call(undefined, this.value())[0];
  }
  if (!retUnwrapped && useLazy) {
    value = onlyLazy ? value : new LazyWrapper(this);
    var result = func.apply(value, args);
    result.__actions__.push(action);
    return new LodashWrapper(result, chainAll);
  }
  return this.thru(interceptor);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps._.prototype.words ()

    words = function () {
  var chainAll = this.__chain__;
  if (chain || chainAll) {
    var result = object(this.__wrapped__),
        actions = result.__actions__ = arrayCopy(this.__actions__);

    actions.push({ 'func': func, 'args': arguments, 'thisArg': object });
    result.__chain__ = chainAll;
    return result;
  }
  return func.apply(object, arrayPush([this.value()], arguments));
}
  • example usage
    n/a

    var result = object(this.__wrapped__),
        actions = result.__actions__ = arrayCopy(this.__actions__);

    actions.push({ 'func': func, 'args': arguments, 'thisArg': object });
    result.__chain__ = chainAll;
    return result;
  }
  return func.apply(object, arrayPush([this.value()], arguments));
}

module bitcore.deps.bs58

function bitcore.deps.bs58.decode (string)

  • description and source-code
    function decode(string) {
  if (string.length === 0) return []

  var i, j, bytes = [0]
  for (i = 0; i < string.length; i++) {
    var c = string[i]
    if (!(c in ALPHABET_MAP)) throw new Error('Non-base58 character')

    for (j = 0; j < bytes.length; j++) bytes[j] *= BASE
    bytes[0] += ALPHABET_MAP[c]

    var carry = 0
    for (j = 0; j < bytes.length; ++j) {
      bytes[j] += carry

      carry = bytes[j] >> 8
      bytes[j] &= 0xff
    }

    while (carry) {
      bytes.push(carry & 0xff)

      carry >>= 8
    }
  }

  // deal with leading zeros
  for (i = 0; string[i] === '1' && i < string.length - 1; i++) bytes.push(0)

  return bytes.reverse()
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps.bs58.encode (buffer)

  • description and source-code
    function encode(buffer) {
  if (buffer.length === 0) return ''

  var i, j, digits = [0]
  for (i = 0; i < buffer.length; i++) {
    for (j = 0; j < digits.length; j++) digits[j] <<= 8

    digits[0] += buffer[i]

    var carry = 0
    for (j = 0; j < digits.length; ++j) {
      digits[j] += carry

      carry = (digits[j] / BASE) | 0
      digits[j] %= BASE
    }

    while (carry) {
      digits.push(carry % BASE)

      carry = (carry / BASE) | 0
    }
  }

  // deal with leading zeros
  for (i = 0; buffer[i] === 0 && i < buffer.length - 1; i++) digits.push(0)

  return digits.reverse().map(function(digit) { return ALPHABET[digit] }).join('')
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module bitcore.deps.elliptic

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.ec (options)

  • description and source-code
    function EC(options) {
  if (!(this instanceof EC))
    return new EC(options);

  // Shortcut `elliptic.ec(curve-name)`
  if (typeof options === 'string') {
    assert(elliptic.curves.hasOwnProperty(options), 'Unknown curve ' + options);

    options = elliptic.curves[options];
  }

  // Shortcut for `elliptic.ec(elliptic.curves.curveName)`
  if (options instanceof elliptic.curves.PresetCurve)
    options = { curve: options };

  this.curve = options.curve.curve;
  this.n = this.curve.n;
  this.nh = this.n.shrn(1);
  this.g = this.curve.g;

  // Point on curve
  this.g = options.curve.g;
  this.g.precompute(options.curve.n.bitLength() + 1);

  // Hash for function for DRBG
  this.hash = options.hash || options.curve.hash;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.hmacDRBG (options)

  • description and source-code
    function HmacDRBG(options) {
  if (!(this instanceof HmacDRBG))
    return new HmacDRBG(options);
  this.hash = options.hash;
  this.predResist = !!options.predResist;

  this.outLen = this.hash.outSize;
  this.minEntropy = options.minEntropy || this.hash.hmacStrength;

  this.reseed = null;
  this.reseedInterval = null;
  this.K = null;
  this.V = null;

  var entropy = utils.toArray(options.entropy, options.entropyEnc);
  var nonce = utils.toArray(options.nonce, options.nonceEnc);
  var pers = utils.toArray(options.pers, options.persEnc);
  assert(entropy.length >= (this.minEntropy / 8),
         'Not enough entropy. Minimum is: ' + this.minEntropy + ' bits');
  this._init(entropy, nonce, pers);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.rand (len)

  • description and source-code
    function rand(len) {
  if (!r)
    r = new Rand(null);

  return r.generate(len);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module bitcore.deps.elliptic.ec.prototype

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.ec.prototype._truncateToN (msg, truncOnly)

  • description and source-code
    function truncateToN(msg, truncOnly) {
  var delta = msg.byteLength() * 8 - this.n.bitLength();
  if (delta > 0)
    msg = msg.shrn(delta);
  if (!truncOnly && msg.cmp(this.n) >= 0)
    return msg.sub(this.n);
  else
    return msg;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.ec.prototype.genKeyPair (options)

  • description and source-code
    function genKeyPair(options) {
  if (!options)
    options = {};

  // Instantiate Hmac_DRBG
  var drbg = new elliptic.hmacDRBG({
    hash: this.hash,
    pers: options.pers,
    entropy: options.entropy || elliptic.rand(this.hash.hmacStrength),
    nonce: this.n.toArray()
  });

  var bytes = this.n.byteLength();
  var ns2 = this.n.sub(new bn(2));
  do {
    var priv = new bn(drbg.generate(bytes));
    if (priv.cmp(ns2) > 0)
      continue;

    priv.iaddn(1);
    return this.keyFromPrivate(priv);
  } while (true);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

    function keyFromPrivate(priv, enc) {
  return KeyPair.fromPrivate(this, priv, enc);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code
    function keyFromPublic(pub, enc) {
  return KeyPair.fromPublic(this, pub, enc);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.ec.prototype.keyPair (options)

  • description and source-code
    function keyPair(options) {
  return new KeyPair(this, options);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.ec.prototype.sign (msg, key, enc, options)

  • description and source-code
    function sign(msg, key, enc, options) {
  if (typeof enc === 'object') {
    options = enc;
    enc = null;
  }
  if (!options)
    options = {};

  key = this.keyFromPrivate(key, enc);
  msg = this._truncateToN(new bn(msg, 16));

  // Zero-extend key to provide enough entropy
  var bytes = this.n.byteLength();
  var bkey = key.getPrivate().toArray();
  for (var i = bkey.length; i < 21; i++)
    bkey.unshift(0);

  // Zero-extend nonce to have the same byte size as N
  var nonce = msg.toArray();
  for (var i = nonce.length; i < bytes; i++)
    nonce.unshift(0);

  // Instantiate Hmac_DRBG
  var drbg = new elliptic.hmacDRBG({
    hash: this.hash,
    entropy: bkey,
    nonce: nonce
  });

  // Number of bytes to generate
  var ns1 = this.n.sub(new bn(1));
  do {
    var k = new bn(drbg.generate(this.n.byteLength()));
    k = this._truncateToN(k, true);
    if (k.cmpn(1) <= 0 || k.cmp(ns1) >= 0)
      continue;

    var kp = this.g.mul(k);
    if (kp.isInfinity())
      continue;

    var r = kp.getX().mod(this.n);
    if (r.cmpn(0) === 0)
      continue;

    var s = k.invm(this.n).mul(r.mul(key.getPrivate()).iadd(msg)).mod(this.n);
    if (s.cmpn(0) === 0)
      continue;

    // Use complement of `s`, if it is > `n / 2`
    if (options.canonical && s.cmp(this.nh) > 0)
      s = this.n.sub(s);

    return new Signature({ r: r, s: s });
  } while (true);
}
  • example usage
    ...
You can then view the Insight block explorer at the default location: `http://localhost:3001/insight`, and your configuration file
 will be found in your home directory at `~/.bitcore`.

Create a transaction:
```js
var bitcore = require('bitcore');
var transaction = new bitcore.Transaction();
var transaction.from(unspent).to(address, amount);
transaction.sign(privateKey);
```

## Applications

- [Node](https://github.com/bitpay/bitcore-node) - A full node with extended capabilities using Bitcoin Core
- [Insight API](https://github.com/bitpay/insight-api) - A blockchain explorer HTTP API
- [Insight UI](https://github.com/bitpay/insight) - A blockchain explorer web user interface
...

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.ec.prototype.verify (msg, signature, key, enc)

  • description and source-code
    function verify(msg, signature, key, enc) {
  msg = this._truncateToN(new bn(msg, 16));
  key = this.keyFromPublic(key, enc);
  signature = new Signature(signature, 'hex');

  // Perform primitive values validation
  var r = signature.r;
  var s = signature.s;
  if (r.cmpn(1) < 0 || r.cmp(this.n) >= 0)
    return false;
  if (s.cmpn(1) < 0 || s.cmp(this.n) >= 0)
    return false;

  // Validate signature
  var sinv = s.invm(this.n);
  var u1 = sinv.mul(msg).mod(this.n);
  var u2 = sinv.mul(r).mod(this.n);

  var p = this.g.mulAdd(u1, key.getPublic(), u2);
  if (p.isInfinity())
    return false;

  return p.getX().mod(this.n).cmp(r) === 0;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module bitcore.deps.elliptic.hmacDRBG.prototype

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.hmacDRBG.prototype._hmac ()

  • description and source-code
    function hmac() {
  return new hash.hmac(this.hash, this.K);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.hmacDRBG.prototype._init (entropy, nonce, pers)

  • description and source-code
    function init(entropy, nonce, pers) {
  var seed = entropy.concat(nonce).concat(pers);

  this.K = new Array(this.outLen / 8);
  this.V = new Array(this.outLen / 8);
  for (var i = 0; i < this.V.length; i++) {
    this.K[i] = 0x00;
    this.V[i] = 0x01;
  }

  this._update(seed);
  this.reseed = 1;
  this.reseedInterval = 0x1000000000000;  // 2^48
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.hmacDRBG.prototype._update (seed)

  • description and source-code
    function update(seed) {
  var kmac = this._hmac()
                 .update(this.V)
                 .update([ 0x00 ]);
  if (seed)
    kmac = kmac.update(seed);
  this.K = kmac.digest();
  this.V = this._hmac().update(this.V).digest();
  if (!seed)
    return;

  this.K = this._hmac()
               .update(this.V)
               .update([ 0x01 ])
               .update(seed)
               .digest();
  this.V = this._hmac().update(this.V).digest();
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.hmacDRBG.prototype.generate (len, enc, add, addEnc)

  • description and source-code
    function generate(len, enc, add, addEnc) {
  if (this.reseed > this.reseedInterval)
    throw new Error('Reseed is required');

  // Optional encoding
  if (typeof enc !== 'string') {
    addEnc = add;
    add = enc;
    enc = null;
  }

  // Optional additional data
  if (add) {
    add = utils.toArray(add, addEnc);
    this._update(add);
  }

  var temp = [];
  while (temp.length < len) {
    this.V = this._hmac().update(this.V).digest();
    temp = temp.concat(this.V);
  }

  var res = temp.slice(0, len);
  this._update(add);
  this.reseed++;
  return utils.encode(res, enc);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.deps.elliptic.hmacDRBG.prototype.reseed (entropy, entropyEnc, add, addEnc)

  • description and source-code
    function reseed(entropy, entropyEnc, add, addEnc) {
  // Optional entropy enc
  if (typeof entropyEnc !== 'string') {
    addEnc = add;
    add = entropyEnc;
    entropyEnc = null;
  }

  entropy = utils.toBuffer(entropy, entropyEnc);
  add = utils.toBuffer(add, addEnc);

  assert(entropy.length >= (this.minEntropy / 8),
         'Not enough entropy. Minimum is: ' + this.minEntropy + ' bits');

  this._update(entropy.concat(add || []));
  this.reseed = 1;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module bitcore.encoding

function bitcore.encoding.Base58 (obj)

  • description and source-code
    function Base58(obj) {
  /* jshint maxcomplexity: 8 */
  if (!(this instanceof Base58)) {
    return new Base58(obj);
  }
  if (Buffer.isBuffer(obj)) {
    var buf = obj;
    this.fromBuffer(buf);
  } else if (typeof obj === 'string') {
    var str = obj;
    this.fromString(str);
  } else if (obj) {
    this.set(obj);
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.Base58Check (obj)

  • description and source-code
    function Base58Check(obj) {
  if (!(this instanceof Base58Check))
    return new Base58Check(obj);
  if (Buffer.isBuffer(obj)) {
    var buf = obj;
    this.fromBuffer(buf);
  } else if (typeof obj === 'string') {
    var str = obj;
    this.fromString(str);
  } else if (obj) {
    this.set(obj);
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader (buf)

  • description and source-code
    function BufferReader(buf) {
  if (!(this instanceof BufferReader)) {
    return new BufferReader(buf);
  }
  if (_.isUndefined(buf)) {
    return;
  }
  if (Buffer.isBuffer(buf)) {
    this.set({
      buf: buf
    });
  } else if (_.isString(buf)) {
    this.set({
      buf: new Buffer(buf, 'hex'),
    });
  } else if (_.isObject(buf)) {
    var obj = buf;
    this.set(obj);
  } else {
    throw new TypeError('Unrecognized argument for BufferReader');
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferWriter (obj)

  • description and source-code
    function BufferWriter(obj) {
  if (!(this instanceof BufferWriter))
    return new BufferWriter(obj);
  if (obj)
    this.set(obj);
  else
    this.bufs = [];
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.Varint (buf)

  • description and source-code
    function Varint(buf) {
  if (!(this instanceof Varint))
    return new Varint(buf);
  if (Buffer.isBuffer(buf)) {
    this.buf = buf;
  } else if (typeof buf === 'number') {
    var num = buf;
    this.fromNumber(num);
  } else if (buf instanceof BN) {
    var bn = buf;
    this.fromBN(bn);
  } else if (buf) {
    var obj = buf;
    this.set(obj);
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.Base58.validCharacters (chars)

  • description and source-code
    function validCharacters(chars) {
  if (buffer.Buffer.isBuffer(chars)) {
    chars = chars.toString();
  }
  return _.all(_.map(chars, function(char) { return _.contains(ALPHABET, char); }));
}

    enabled: true,
    usePhantomJS: false,
    postDetection: function(availableBrowser) {
      // modify to enable additional browsers if available

module bitcore.encoding.Base58Check

function bitcore.encoding.Base58Check (obj)

  • description and source-code
    function Base58Check(obj) {
  if (!(this instanceof Base58Check))
    return new Base58Check(obj);
  if (Buffer.isBuffer(obj)) {
    var buf = obj;
    this.fromBuffer(buf);
  } else if (typeof obj === 'string') {
    var str = obj;
    this.fromString(str);
  } else if (obj) {
    this.set(obj);
  }
}

function bitcore.encoding.Base58Check.checksum (buffer)

  • description and source-code
    checksum = function (buffer) {
  return sha256sha256(buffer).slice(0, 4);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.Base58Check.decode (s)

  • description and source-code
    decode = function (s) {
  if (typeof s !== 'string')
    throw new Error('Input must be a string');

  var buf = new Buffer(Base58.decode(s));

  if (buf.length < 4)
    throw new Error("Input string too short");

  var data = buf.slice(0, -4);
  var csum = buf.slice(-4);

  var hash = sha256sha256(data);
  var hash4 = hash.slice(0, 4);

  if (csum.toString('hex') !== hash4.toString('hex'))
    throw new Error("Checksum mismatch");

  return data;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.Base58Check.encode (buf)

  • description and source-code
    encode = function (buf) {
  if (!Buffer.isBuffer(buf))
    throw new Error('Input must be a buffer');
  var checkedBuf = new Buffer(buf.length + 4);
  var hash = Base58Check.checksum(buf);
  buf.copy(checkedBuf);
  hash.copy(checkedBuf, buf.length);
  return Base58.encode(checkedBuf);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.Base58Check.validChecksum (data, checksum)

  • description and source-code
    function validChecksum(data, checksum) {
  if (_.isString(data)) {
    data = new buffer.Buffer(Base58.decode(data));
  }
  if (_.isString(checksum)) {
    checksum = new buffer.Buffer(Base58.decode(checksum));
  }
  if (!checksum) {
    checksum = data.slice(-4);
    data = data.slice(0, -4);
  }
  return Base58Check.checksum(data).toString('hex') === checksum.toString('hex');
}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • example usage
    n/a

module bitcore.encoding.BufferReader

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader (buf)

  • description and source-code
    function BufferReader(buf) {
  if (!(this instanceof BufferReader)) {
    return new BufferReader(buf);
  }
  if (_.isUndefined(buf)) {
    return;
  }
  if (Buffer.isBuffer(buf)) {
    this.set({
      buf: buf
    });
  } else if (_.isString(buf)) {
    this.set({
      buf: new Buffer(buf, 'hex'),
    });
  } else if (_.isObject(buf)) {
    var obj = buf;
    this.set(obj);
  } else {
    throw new TypeError('Unrecognized argument for BufferReader');
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.eof ()

  • description and source-code
    eof = function () {
  return this.pos >= this.buf.length;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.finished ()

  • description and source-code
    finished = function () {
  return this.pos >= this.buf.length;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.read (len)

  • description and source-code
    read = function (len) {
  $.checkArgument(!_.isUndefined(len), 'Must specify a length');
  var buf = this.buf.slice(this.pos, this.pos + len);
  this.pos = this.pos + len;
  return buf;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.readAll ()

  • description and source-code
    readAll = function () {
  var buf = this.buf.slice(this.pos, this.buf.length);
  this.pos = this.buf.length;
  return buf;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.readReverse (len)

  • description and source-code
    readReverse = function (len) {
  if (_.isUndefined(len)) {
    len = this.buf.length;
  }
  var buf = this.buf.slice(this.pos, this.pos + len);
  this.pos = this.pos + len;
  return BufferUtil.reverse(buf);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.readUInt16BE ()

  • description and source-code
    readUInt16BE = function () {
  var val = this.buf.readUInt16BE(this.pos);
  this.pos = this.pos + 2;
  return val;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.readUInt16LE ()

  • description and source-code
    readUInt16LE = function () {
  var val = this.buf.readUInt16LE(this.pos);
  this.pos = this.pos + 2;
  return val;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code
    readUInt32BE = function () {
  var val = this.buf.readUInt32BE(this.pos);
  this.pos = this.pos + 4;
  return val;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.readUInt32LE ()

  • description and source-code
    readUInt32LE = function () {
  var val = this.buf.readUInt32LE(this.pos);
  this.pos = this.pos + 4;
  return val;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.readUInt64BEBN ()

  • description and source-code
    readUInt64BEBN = function () {
  var buf = this.buf.slice(this.pos, this.pos + 8);
  var bn = BN.fromBuffer(buf);
  this.pos = this.pos + 8;
  return bn;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.readUInt64LEBN ()

  • description and source-code
    readUInt64LEBN = function () {
  var second = this.buf.readUInt32LE(this.pos);
  var first = this.buf.readUInt32LE(this.pos + 4);
  var combined = (first * 0x100000000) + second;
  // Instantiating an instance of BN with a number is faster than with an
  // array or string. However, the maximum safe number for a double precision
  // floating point is 2 ^ 52 - 1 (0x1fffffffffffff), thus we can safely use
  // non-floating point numbers less than this amount (52 bits). And in the case
  // that the number is larger, we can instatiate an instance of BN by passing
  // an array from the buffer (slower) and specifying the endianness.
  var bn;
  if (combined <= 0x1fffffffffffff) {
    bn = new BN(combined);
  } else {
    var data = Array.prototype.slice.call(this.buf, this.pos, this.pos + 8);
    bn = new BN(data, 10, 'le');
  }
  this.pos = this.pos + 8;
  return bn;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.readUInt8 ()

  • description and source-code
    readUInt8 = function () {
  var val = this.buf.readUInt8(this.pos);
  this.pos = this.pos + 1;
  return val;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.readVarLengthBuffer ()

  • description and source-code
    readVarLengthBuffer = function () {
  var len = this.readVarintNum();
  var buf = this.read(len);
  $.checkState(buf.length === len, 'Invalid length while reading varlength buffer. ' +
    'Expected to read: ' + len + ' and read ' + buf.length);
  return buf;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.readVarintBN ()

  • description and source-code
    readVarintBN = function () {
  var first = this.readUInt8();
  switch (first) {
    case 0xFD:
      return new BN(this.readUInt16LE());
    case 0xFE:
      return new BN(this.readUInt32LE());
    case 0xFF:
      return this.readUInt64LEBN();
    default:
      return new BN(first);
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.readVarintBuf ()

  • description and source-code
    readVarintBuf = function () {
  var first = this.buf.readUInt8(this.pos);
  switch (first) {
    case 0xFD:
      return this.read(1 + 2);
    case 0xFE:
      return this.read(1 + 4);
    case 0xFF:
      return this.read(1 + 8);
    default:
      return this.read(1);
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.readVarintNum ()

  • description and source-code
    readVarintNum = function () {
  var first = this.readUInt8();
  switch (first) {
    case 0xFD:
      return this.readUInt16LE();
    case 0xFE:
      return this.readUInt32LE();
    case 0xFF:
      var bn = this.readUInt64LEBN();
      var n = bn.toNumber();
      if (n <= Math.pow(2, 53)) {
        return n;
      } else {
        throw new Error('number too large to retain precision - use readVarintBN');
      }
      break;
    default:
      return first;
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.reverse ()

  • description and source-code
    reverse = function () {
  var buf = new Buffer(this.buf.length);
  for (var i = 0; i < buf.length; i++) {
    buf[i] = this.buf[this.buf.length - 1 - i];
  }
  this.buf = buf;
  return this;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferReader.prototype.set (obj)

  • description and source-code
    set = function (obj) {
  this.buf = obj.buf || this.buf || undefined;
  this.pos = obj.pos || this.pos || 0;
  return this;
}
  • example usage
    ...

      // modify to enable additional browsers if available

module bitcore.encoding.BufferWriter

function bitcore.encoding.BufferWriter (obj)

  • description and source-code
    function BufferWriter(obj) {
  if (!(this instanceof BufferWriter))
    return new BufferWriter(obj);
  if (obj)
    this.set(obj);
  else
    this.bufs = [];
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferWriter.varintBufBN (bn)

  • description and source-code
    varintBufBN = function (bn) {
  var buf = undefined;
  var n = bn.toNumber();
  if (n < 253) {
    buf = new Buffer(1);
    buf.writeUInt8(n, 0);
  } else if (n < 0x10000) {
    buf = new Buffer(1 + 2);
    buf.writeUInt8(253, 0);
    buf.writeUInt16LE(n, 1);
  } else if (n < 0x100000000) {
    buf = new Buffer(1 + 4);
    buf.writeUInt8(254, 0);
    buf.writeUInt32LE(n, 1);
  } else {
    var bw = new BufferWriter();
    bw.writeUInt8(255);
    bw.writeUInt64LEBN(bn);
    var buf = bw.concat();
  }
  return buf;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferWriter.varintBufNum (n)

  • description and source-code
    varintBufNum = function (n) {
  var buf = undefined;
  if (n < 253) {
    buf = new Buffer(1);
    buf.writeUInt8(n, 0);
  } else if (n < 0x10000) {
    buf = new Buffer(1 + 2);
    buf.writeUInt8(253, 0);
    buf.writeUInt16LE(n, 1);
  } else if (n < 0x100000000) {
    buf = new Buffer(1 + 4);
    buf.writeUInt8(254, 0);
    buf.writeUInt32LE(n, 1);
  } else {
    buf = new Buffer(1 + 8);
    buf.writeUInt8(255, 0);
    buf.writeInt32LE(n & -1, 1);
    buf.writeUInt32LE(Math.floor(n / 0x100000000), 5);
  }
  return buf;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module bitcore.encoding.BufferWriter.prototype

function bitcore.encoding.BufferWriter.prototype.concat ()

  • description and source-code
    concat = function () {
  return Buffer.concat(this.bufs);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.BufferWriter.prototype.set (obj)

  • description and source-code
    set = function (obj) {
  this.bufs = obj.bufs || this.bufs || [];
  return this;
}
  • example usage
    ...

module bitcore.encoding.Varint

function bitcore.encoding.Varint (buf)

  • description and source-code
    function Varint(buf) {
  if (!(this instanceof Varint))
    return new Varint(buf);
  if (Buffer.isBuffer(buf)) {
    this.buf = buf;
  } else if (typeof buf === 'number') {
    var num = buf;
    this.fromNumber(num);
  } else if (buf instanceof BN) {
    var bn = buf;
    this.fromBN(bn);
  } else if (buf) {
    var obj = buf;
    this.set(obj);
  }
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module bitcore.encoding.Varint.prototype

function bitcore.encoding.Varint.prototype.fromBN (bn)

  • description and source-code
    fromBN = function (bn) {
  this.buf = BufferWriter().writeVarintBN(bn).concat();
  return this;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.Varint.prototype.fromBuffer (buf)

  • description and source-code
    fromBuffer = function (buf) {
  this.buf = buf;
  return this;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.Varint.prototype.fromBufferReader (br)

  • description and source-code
    fromBufferReader = function (br) {
  this.buf = br.readVarintBuf();
  return this;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.Varint.prototype.fromNumber (num)

  • description and source-code
    fromNumber = function (num) {
  this.buf = BufferWriter().writeVarintNum(num).concat();
  return this;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.encoding.Varint.prototype.fromString (str)

  • description and source-code
    fromString = function (str) {
  this.set({
    buf: new Buffer(str, 'hex')
  });
  return this;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

  • description and source-code

  this.buf = obj.buf || this.buf;
  return this;

module bitcore.errors

function bitcore.errors ()

  • description and source-code
    errors = function () {
  this.message = 'Internal error';
  this.stack = this.message + '\n' + (new Error()).stack;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.errors.AbstractMethodInvoked ()

  • description and source-code
    AbstractMethodInvoked = function () {
  if (_.isString(errorDefinition.message)) {
    this.message = format(errorDefinition.message, arguments);
  } else if (_.isFunction(errorDefinition.message)) {
    this.message = errorDefinition.message.apply(null, arguments);
  } else {
    throw new Error('Invalid error definition for ' + errorDefinition.name);
  }
  this.stack = this.message + '\n' + (new Error()).stack;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

  }

}

  • example usage
    ...
```

You can then view the Insight block explorer at the default location: `http://localhost:3001/insight`, and your configuration file
 will be found in your home directory at `~/.bitcore`.

Create a transaction:
```js
var bitcore = require('bitcore');
var transaction = new bitcore.Transaction();
var transaction.from(unspent).to(address, amount);
transaction.sign(privateKey);
```

## Applications

- [Node](https://github.com/bitpay/bitcore-node) - A full node with extended capabilities using Bitcoin Core
...

function bitcore.errors.Unit ()

  • description and source-code
    Unit = function () {
  if (_.isString(errorDefinition.message)) {
    this.message = format(errorDefinition.message, arguments);
  } else if (_.isFunction(errorDefinition.message)) {
    this.message = errorDefinition.message.apply(null, arguments);
  } else {
    throw new Error('Invalid error definition for ' + errorDefinition.name);
  }
  this.stack = this.message + '\n' + (new Error()).stack;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

function bitcore.errors.extend (spec)

  • description and source-code
    extend = function (spec) {
  return traverseNode(bitcore.Error, spec);
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module bitcore.errors.HDPrivateKey

function bitcore.errors.HDPrivateKey ()

  • description and source-code
    HDPrivateKey = function () {
  if (_.isString(errorDefinition.message)) {
    this.message = format(errorDefinition.message, arguments);
  } else if (_.isFunction(errorDefinition.message)) {
    this.message = errorDefinition.message.apply(null, arguments);
  } else {
    throw new Error('Invalid error definition for ' + errorDefinition.name);
  }
  this.stack = this.message + '\n' + (new Error()).stack;
}
  • example usage
    n/a

module bitcore.errors.Transaction

function bitcore.errors.Transaction ()

  • description and source-code
    Transaction = function () {
  if (_.isString(errorDefinition.message)) {
    this.message = format(errorDefinition.message, arguments);
  } else if (_.isFunction(errorDefinition.message)) {
    this.message = errorDefinition.message.apply(null, arguments);
  } else {
    throw new Error('Invalid error definition for ' + errorDefinition.name);
  }
  this.stack = this.message + '\n' + (new Error()).stack;
}
  • example usage
    ...
```

You can then view the Insight block explorer at the default location: `http://localhost:3001/insight`, and your configuration file
 will be found in your home directory at `~/.bitcore`.

Create a transaction:
```js
var bitcore = require('bitcore');
var transaction = new bitcore.Transaction();
var transaction.from(unspent).to(address, amount);
transaction.sign(privateKey);
```

## Applications

- [Node](https://github.com/bitpay/bitcore-node) - A full node with extended capabilities using Bitcoin Core
...
